SEARCH
Module FloWeekTracker
Package org.example.floweektracker.planner.plannerManagerDialogs

Class TaskDialogUI

java.lang.Object
com.floweektracker.planner.plannerManagerDialogs.TaskDialogUI
Direct Known Subclasses:
TaskAddingDialogUI, TaskEditingDialogUI
public class TaskDialogUI extends Object
Represents the UI of the dialog serves as a base for the TaskAddingDialogUI and TaskEditingDialogUI classes, allowing the user to add or edit a task.

Fields:
  • dialog - a JDialog represents the dialog shown to the user, allowing them to add or edit a task
  • dialogButtons - an array of JButton representing buttons displayed within the dialog
  • weekDaysComboBox - a JComboBox representing a combo box with weekdays, displayed within the dialog
  • tasksComboBox - a JComboBox representing a combo box with task names, displayed within the dialog
  • timeSpinner - a JSpinner representing a spinner allowing the user to choose a time, displayed within the dialog
  • prioritySpinner - a JSpinner representing a spinner allowing the user to choose a priority, displayed within the dialog
  • descriptionTextArea - a JTextArea representing a text area allowing the user to enter the description of the task, displayed within the dialog
  • planners - a HashMap containing tasks sorted by each day of the week
  • task - a reference to a SingleTaskManager representing a single task
Configuration methods:
  • configureDialog() - configures the dialog adding common components and settings for both TaskAddingDialogUI and TaskEditingDialogUI
Dialog panels creators:
  • createTaskSelectionPanel() - creates a JPanel containing components allowing the user to select a name for the task
  • createWeekDaySelectionPanel() - creates a JPanel containing components allowing the user to select the weekday for the task
  • createTimeSelectionPanel() - creates a JPanel containing components allowing the user to select the time for the task
  • createPrioritySelectionPanel() - creates a JPanel containing components allowing the user to select the priority of the task
  • createDescriptionPanel() - creates a JPanel containing components allowing the user to enter the description of the task
  • createButtonsPanel() - creates a JPanel containing JButtons allowing the user to save task or cancel the action
  • createPanel(Component, String) - creates a JPanel for the other panel creation methods, based on the provided parameters
Getters: getPlanners(), getDialogButtons(), getWeekDaysComboBox(), getTimeSpinner(), getPrioritySpinner(), getDescriptionTextArea(), getTasksComboBox(), getTask(), getDialog()

  • Method Summary

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
